messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Throwing things
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/02 1:44:01 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Do you mean the movie wisdom never to attack in anger is WRONG? But it s always true in
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/02 1:44:01 PM Central Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:
>
> << One day Marty was furious with Kirby about something, and he got his
> archery
> equipment, and the first shot was a bull's eye, and the rest of the quiver
> hit the target too. That had to be a satisfying use of adrenaline. >>

Do you mean the movie wisdom never to attack in anger is WRONG? But it's
always true in movies! Whenever they forget that bit they get pummeled.

Or is it only true when they're *told* that piece of wisdom?

Ah, inductive reasoning has lead me astray. ::: sigh :::

Joyce

messages.subject: Throwing things
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/02 1:44:01 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/02 1:44:01 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< One day Marty was furious with Kirby about something, and he got his
archery
equipment, and the first shot was a bull's eye, and the rest of the quiver
hit the target too. That had to be a satisfying use of adrenaline. >>

Trevor does this type of thing when angry too. It's either Archery, BB Gun or
a stick in the woods.
He used to take a stick and absolutely TRASH the weeds growing out in our
woods.
Now that he has weaponry, he uses that to vent.
It really helps him to let out his frustration that way.
Ren
